main event: Two objects were observed in the sky above Big Spring, Texas, on June 15, 1963, characterized as gray or steady burning, giving white flashes with explosions observed intermittently.
interesting points: The sighting lasted between 30 seconds to 1 minute and involved both ground and aerial observers., An explosion sound was reported during the sighting., The objects were estimated to be 8 feet in diameter and 8-10 feet long., A search was conducted for about 1 hour without results., The objects were concluded to be a balloon after investigation.
sighted object: two gray or steady burning objects
witness description: civilian and military observers including Capt Jack G. Sullivan and other military personnel.
